Body: I need a browser that supports websocket and full screen mode and where I can set a default homepage.The device that I am using is Rikomagic MK802 III. I am using a startup program to open a browser in full screen mode with a default URL when the machine is booted.The default stock Android browser works fine, but does not support websocket. It also does not have a very good support for JavaScript.Next, I tried with Chrome, Firefox and Opera. All of them support websocket and works fine. But none of them have a provision to set a default homepage and full screen also is not supported.However I found an add-on in Firefox that supports full screen, but don't know how to make this a default behavior when the browser is opened. Setting default homepage is still a problem.Please suggest me what option I am left with. Is there any workaround ?
Title: Need browser with websocket and full screen mode support

history.Text: I need a browser that support **websocket and full screen mode** and where I can set a **default homepage**.The device that i am using is Rikomagic **MK802 III**. i am using a startup program to open a browser in full screen mode with a default url when the machine is booted.The default stock android browser works fine, but **does not support websocket**. It also does not have a very good support for Javascript.Next I tried with Chrome, Firefox and Opera. All of them support websocket and works fine. **But none of them have a provision to set a default homepage and full screen also is not supported.**However i found an add on in firefox that support full screen (https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/android/addon/full-screen-252573/?src=hp-dl-featured), but do not know how to make this a default behavior when the browser is opened. Setting default homepage is still a problem.Please suggest me what option I am left with. Is there any workaround ?

I need a browser that supports **websocket and full screen mode** and where I can set a **default homepage**.The device that I am using is Rikomagic **MK802 III**. I am using a startup program to open a browser in full screen mode with a default URL when the machine is booted.The default stock Android browser works fine, but **does not support websocket**. It also does not have a very good support for JavaScript.Next, I tried with Chrome, Firefox and Opera. All of them support websocket and works fine. **But none of them have a provision to set a default homepage and full screen also is not supported.**However I found [an add-on in Firefox that supports full screen][1], but don't know how to make this a default behavior when the browser is opened. Setting default homepage is still a problem.Please suggest me what option I am left with. Is there any workaround ?  [1]: https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/android/addon/full-screen-252573/?src=hp-dl-featured
